title: Will adding Malwarebytes privacy software to my MWB regular protection cause problems with Firefox Monitor or vice versa? I've been the victim of breaches.
content: I've had a hacker or whatever you would call someone who gets into my computer regularly. I have Malwarebytes Virus Protection and am going to get MWB Privacy. My debit card has been frozen x 15 days now without their sending me a new one. What this thug does is go to my email account, sign in as me, and tell them he/I forgot the password. Then he can verify it, and then he does the same thing. For about four months, he came and went, and all he did was change all my passwords. No matter what kind of secure p/w I used, he could always change it. On 04/26, I saw a charge on my debit card for $1.00 from FacebookPay or whatever, a verification charge. I immediately called FBPay and told them that was a fraudulent charge. I asked them to close the FBPay account. They did, but they also, without my permission, froze my card. I immediately reported that to the bank but they were busy merging with another bank, and they lie, so I still don't have access to my stimulus check or my last two paychecks. New bank is assuring me it's in the mail. Naturally, I want to know what to do when I get my new debit card so the thug won't see it. I figure I can either order things I need from Amazon and eBay and then delete the card, or I could call them and give them the card info. I've been told I need to have this computer wiped clean, but that would leave me with no means of communication or getting my money out, since they only let you get $500 a day.. How do I deal with this thug? Thank you. I don't know much about computers. I'm considering taking it back to the store where I bought it and demanding one exactly like it or better but I don't know if that would go over or not. I can't pay rent, buy food, pay any bills, or do anything because the debit card people have all my money. I need to resolve the problem of my thug before I set up a new computer. Thank you so much for reading this and trying to help me. Marcia
creator: marciam12

title: When I go to cloudflare websites I get Error 1001 Ray ID: 59155673d9adc50c. Please help!
content: When I go to archive.is for example I get error 1001 Ray...etc. Screenshot below. But this doesn't help, as you have to login to your cloudflare account, which I have never had. This problem only occurs with firefox. I have tried other browsers and can access archive.is without a problem. Everything is normal. Now I cleared my cookies (which is when this error happened afterwards) and unplugged my modem for a few minutes (about 15) in order to get a new IP address (someone somewhere I read mentioned that might help). This didn't do anything, same error as before. I also went to about:preferences#privacy and clicked "standard" (for some reason it was at custom and had been blocking cookies, not sure why, I didn't do that). Then I went to cloudflare support, but you have to have an account to ask questions. I set one up with my email, but then you have to add your website. I HAVE NO WEBSITE! So I don't know what to do, and this has never happened before. This is not a problem on other devices, or on this computer with other browsers. I am using a windows 10 PC and have a dynamic IP address. Please help.

title: Latest version of Firefox causes intermittent lag spikes
content:
I have the latest version (76.0.1) and I've noticed that the browser itself is giving me problems with my ping - specifically a high ping spike every 5 seconds. At first I thought it might be my wireless receiver playing up on me (I don't have a hardline connection, it's not an option) as I use a 4G router or my phone as a 4G access point.

While doing troubleshooting and trying to find ways of making the lag minimise or stop altogether, I upgraded the wireless receiver's drivers and restarted the system. All started out well as it rebooted, I had Pingplotter up and testing a ping to Google, was looking good as the ping stayed mostly in the green (I'm in Australia, high ping is a thing here). So I booted up Firefox, and the ping started going back to the way it was before I rebooted the system, ie. a high ping spike (in the red) every 5 seconds. There's a definite pattern to it as well, as I have saved graphs showing what's going on.

I'm using Chrome for the time being, but I've been using Firefox for years prior and very minimal hiccups to speak of, until now. This is a BIG hiccup for me, as I use my PC for gaming online, and this ping spike every 5 seconds is unacceptable.

I'm willing to try out any possible fixes, but at this point it's DEFINITELY a Firefox issue reacting badly with my internet connection.
creator: vk2farg

title: On my MacBook Pro w. MacOS 10.15, I've reset cmnd-v for paste to ctrl-v; and now Edit menu shows ^V but it's not working. Other resets to ctrl DO work (^C, ^X)
content: MacBook Pro 2019 MacOS 10.15x Firefox 76.0.1 64-bit I've successfully reset various hotkeys for Firefox on Mac to use ctrl (^) instead of command. To do this I used System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Shortcuts -> App Shortcuts where there's a section for Firefox.app. There, I've added these resets: Cut ^X Copy ^C Paste ^V Select All ^A Find in This Page... ^F All of these work, except ^V for Paste. The key combo even shows in the Firefox menu bar Edit pull-down menu. But when I have a string of text in the clipboard and use ^V nothing happens (oh, I do see a little flash of the Edit option on the Firefox toolbar any time I hit ^V, but the clipboard content isn't pasted. I still have to use command-V, which is so annoying for this long-time Windows user who has control key shortcuts burned into his muscle memory. Anyone have any idea why ^V reset isn't working?

title: Suchmaschine ändern für google schweiz suche

Hallo Zusammen

Bis vor kurzem war noch ein Add-On namens "Google ch" erhältlich, was nun nicht mehr auffindbar ist. Ein eigener Suchstring konnte ich bis jetzt auch nirgens eingeben und beim drücken des "Suchmaschine hinzufügen" Buttons, kam nur die Suchseite der Add-On's, was natürlich nicht weiterhilft..

Das ändern der Suchregion in den Einstellungen der Website ist keine Option!

Gerne kann google.com auch gleich komplett ersetzt werden. Es kommt nämlich bei der Eingabe von google im Suchfeld auch immer gleich google.com als Vorschlag obwohl diese Seite nie aufgerufen wird.. Sehr sehr mühsam das Ganze!

Gruss Roman

title: web not working for FF but working all browsers
content:
I can’t seem to be able to replicate this on my machine (i.e. it looks exactly the same in Chrome and FF). Could you please let me know which Chrome version you’re using (go to the three dots in the top right corner and choose “Help – About Google Chrome” from the menu), as well as your screen resolution. If you don’t know the latter, https://www.pakainfo.com/what-is-my-screen-resolution-whatismyscreenresolution/ try this website.

I wished there was an option in settings page (or even an add-on) where you can set Firefox's screen resolution (which can be any number, up to the device's display resolution).

This is not exactly a bug, but it is a very important feature request.

https://www.pakainfo.com/what-is-my-screen-resolution-whatismyscreenresolution/
